content.description: A low crux requiring a powerful crank off an undercling and a dynamic move to a pocket leads to some long reaches between drilled pockets and jugs. Many of the holds are manufactured, but the moves are bouldery and fun, so that has to count for something, I guess.
content.protection: Bolts. It may help to stick clip the first two bolts.
content.location: Near the middle of the Oven, this is two bolt lines to the left of Terminal Vector, the obvious roof crack.

content.description: Technical crimps and side pulls with a great dyno leads you to eventually getting crammed up into the roof crack that explodes out left. The roof crack is a series of underclings and hard ring locks. Tricky Beta...get creative.
content.protection: 2 bolts and then fixed draws to the anchor
content.location: Right/Center of the oven start under big roof.

content.description: Pull the low crux bulge - a great boulder problem on small edges and knobs - and clip the second bolt. Continue on with sustained, technical crimping to a final desperate move near the top. A short, but totally classic route on bullet rock.
content.protection: 4 bolts to Mussy Hooks. It would be wise to stick clip the first bolt or have a spot, use good judgment.
content.location: Walking right from Mall Wall and Way Gone, this is the last bolt line before the Oven starts to turn mega-steep. Skirts the edge of a roof/bulge.

content.description: This is the last route on the right side of The Oven before you turn the corner. Follow a rightward leaning bolt line through thin moves to a very improbable crux (maybe a dyno?), clip the chains on the right side of the lip.
content.location: Last route on the right side under the huge roof that is The Oven. look for a diagonal line of bolts leading to chains on the right side of the lip of the roof.

climbs.name: Put Your Fingers In My Pockets

content.description: A nice slice of slab climbing on the far left side of The Oven. Delicate moves through the first two bolts to a thin section guarding the anchors.
content.location: On the far left side of The Oven, climbing just to the right of a dihedral.

content.description: Climb up and over a bulge to good pockets and a ledge. From the ledge, balance past two bolts with a technical sequence that stays on you till the anchors are clipped. Short, but packed with hard and thought-provoking moves.
content.location: Right end of The Oven, around the corner from the big Terminal Vector roof. Starts to the right of the old pine tree.

content.description: Power up through the undercling (or gaston - depending on beta).  Traverse right to a jug.  A wild dyno up an unlikely arete to anchors.

Somewhat short but worthwhile for those looking to climb something more moderate.  If the Son Tower and Popeye are busy and you don't want to climb 3 Beers Shy of a Lunar Eclipse this is a great alternative. I was looking for a route that my daughters could enjoy climbing when they get a little older and something for folks just getting into the lead game could safely learn to clip bolts on.  Tried to get some insight from a new leader on the comfortability of the clipping stances and climbing so I hope folks enjoy.  Named for my daughters and young Adler who snagged the first 6 y.o. ascent.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with quick links and leaver biners, please don't steal biners!
content.location: Just to the left of "Put Your Fingers in My Pockets".  Standard Pit bouldery start with first bolt high enough to keep you off the ground.  Climb back and forth between the right and left side, finishing just below rim on the left.  The pillar on the left sounds a bit hollow, hence the bolts are to the right of it.  Options exist for top rope line to the left of the pillar as well.  (Large block in corner is loose and will be trundles next time I'm out, ran out of time after equiping route)

content.description: Climb the first 3 bolts of "Crucifix", then angle left to clip off of a flat jug.  Power up to the anchors.  The crux is pulling through difficult underclings at the beginning of the route. Classic, sustaining, and natural.  A real beauty.
content.location: The anchors are located in between Running Man (12b) and Crucifix (13d)

content.description: A two-move wonder. Climb the vertical face past two bolts to a low-percentage stab for the notch above the bulge. Establish in the seam above and climb easily to the anchors.
content.location: Right end of The Oven, just to the right of the Terminal Vector roof. Body Language begins straight down from the right end of the roof and goes over a bulge.

content.description: The Oven is easily identified by the huge roof in the right-center portion of the wall. This section of rock contains a dense collection of super-hard routes!
